data.title: National Film Registry
data.meta_description: Each year since 1989, the Library of Congress adds 25 films to the National Film Registry to ensure that each film will be preserved in its original form. The films, which must be at least 10 years old, are chosen based on “their historical, cultural and aesthetic significance.
data.text:
Each year since 1989, the Library of Congress adds 25 films to the National Film Registry to ensure that each film will be preserved in its original form. The films, which must be at least 10 years old, are chosen based on “their historical, cultural and aesthetic significance.”
